485d537652e0f461ab6f8a2ae42b0988: The Persians could and did levy a large number of infantry during wartime due to the sheer size of the Achaemenid Empire and the way in which it was set-up. In general the Persian infantry was well trained and fought with great tenacity. However while this was true the infantry were poor hand-to-hand, close combat fighters. Also, with the exception of the elite regiments, the Persian infantry was not a standing professional force.

895a9d879f773e5868b81abfa7fac357: Early Achaemenid rulers acted towards making Persia the first great Asian empire to rule the seas. The Great King behaved favourably towards the various sea peoples in order to secure their services, but also carried out various marine initiatives. During the reign of Darius the Great, for example, a canal was built in Egypt and a Persian navy was sent exploring the Indus river. According to Herodotus, some 300 ships in the Persian navy were retrofitted to carry horses and their riders.
89ffaacebc568372f89eef379a82e996: Body armor made of small metal rings linked together.
8b9bfa8bae35347ccdb8fafd3ab334d8: Wooden reinforcement beams for ship hulls.
8f9cec2c45e7c9175bf9eb6f69669c79: The Persians built the wonderful 1677 mile-long Royal Highway from Sardis to Susa; Darius the Great and Xerxes also built the magnificent Persepolis; Cyrus the Great greatly improved Ecbatana and virtually 'rebuilt' the old Elamite capital of Susa.
966fa6a2098a4bf37a3a2b18772f1382: Beginning with Alexander, the Hellenistic monarchs founded many cities throughout their empires, where Greek culture and art blended with local customs to create the motley Hellenistic civilization.
97f42360d0400396948d11b7c44c9107: The Mauryan Empire encompassed dozens of formerly independent kingdoms over an area of 5 million square kilometers, with a population of close to 60 million people. The Mauryan regents held the title Emperor of Emperors and commanded a standing army of 600,000 infantry, 9000 elephants, 8000 chariots, and 30,000 cavalry, making it arguably the largest army of its time.

f4a3cb1857b38985bb66410dd304bc99: Sun-dried mud bricks were a common building material in hot and dry areas, especially where wood was scarce.
